meanings.definition: Disgust or sicken with an excess of sweetness or richness.
meanings.sent1: The sugary drink began to cloy my taste buds.
meanings.sent2: The dessert was so cloying that I couldn't finish it.
meanings.sent3: The cloying sweetness of the cake made me feel queasy.
meanings.sent4: The perfume's cloying scent lingered in the room for hours.
meanings.sent5: The cloying smell of the flowers overwhelmed the small space.

meanings.sent1: The cloying love letter was filled with exaggerated emotions.
meanings.sent2: The movie's ending was too cloying for my taste.
meanings.sent3: She found his cloying compliments amusing rather than endearing.
meanings.sent4: The cloying melody of the song stayed in her mind all day.
meanings.sent5: The cloying sweetness of the candy made her teeth ache.
